title: Baseball preview, 2021: Strong with gloves & bats. A look at top corner infielders
body: Schalick junior Jarrett Pokrovsky batted close to .400 as a freshman in 2019, making a serious impact in his first varsity season. They’re the guys throwing across the diamond with pinpoint accuracy, the ones that usually bring some serious pop to the plate when it’s their time to hit.First basemen and third basemen - the corner infielders.Led by a handful of major college recruits, there are plenty of standouts in New Jersey this spring. As part of the NJ Advance Media baseball staff’s 2021 season preview, take a look below at some of the best corner infielders heading into Opening Day on April 19.: With last season not being played, the usual amount of preseason information available this spring has been limited. Preview content is based on information supplied by coaches via information forms that were sent to every high school in the state as well as conversations with area scouts.Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
